MATA Extension Installation Guide

Return to App

Why Install the MATA Extension?

The MATA browser extension enhances your security and experience by providing:

  • Secure Key Backup: Your encryption keys are securely stored in the extension's protected storage.
  • Cross-Device Access: Access your vaults across different devices by syncing your keys.
  • Enhanced Security: Add an additional layer of security for your sensitive data.
  • Offline Support: Maintain access to your vaults even when offline.

Installation Steps

1

Download the Extension

Download the MATA browser extension package from our website.

Download Extension

File: mata-extension.zip (~12KB)

2

Extract the ZIP File

Extract the downloaded ZIP file to a folder on your computer.

  1. Right-click the downloaded ZIP file
  2. Select "Extract All..." or use your preferred extraction tool
  3. Choose a location that you can easily find later
  4. Complete the extraction process

Make sure to remember where you extracted the files!

3

Open Chrome Extensions Page

Open the Chrome Extensions page to load the unpacked extension.

Method 1: Enter this in your address bar:

chrome://extensions

Method 2: Navigate through Chrome menu:

  1. Click the three dots (â‹®) in the top-right corner
  2. Select "More tools"
  3. Click "Extensions"
4

Enable Developer Mode

Enable Developer Mode in the Chrome Extensions page.

  1. Look for the "Developer mode" toggle in the top-right corner of the extensions page
  2. Click the toggle to enable Developer mode
5

Load the Extension

Load the unpacked extension into Chrome.

  1. Click the "Load unpacked" button in the top-left area
  2. Navigate to the folder where you extracted the extension files
  3. Click "Select Folder" to load the extension
6

Verify Installation

Verify that the extension is properly installed and working.

  1. The MATA extension icon should appear in your Chrome toolbar
  2. Return to the MATA application and refresh the page
  3. The app should detect the extension automatically
  4. If not, click the "Recheck" button in the extension status banner
Return to App

Troubleshooting

Extension Not Detected

  • Make sure you've completed all installation steps correctly
  • Refresh the MATA application page
  • Check if the extension appears in your Chrome extensions list
  • Ensure that the extension is enabled
  • Try restarting your browser

Storage Issues

  • Make sure the extension has the necessary permissions
  • Try reinstalling the extension
  • Check Chrome's console for error messages (F12)
  • Clear your browser cache and cookies (may remove saved data)

Extension Keeps Disconnecting

  • Ensure Chrome is updated to the latest version
  • Try using a different Chrome profile
  • Disable other extensions that might interfere with MATA
  • Reinstall the extension with the latest version
